channel.title: angularjs on I Prefer Jim
channel.description: Recent content in angularjs on I Prefer Jim

item.title: Create configurable Angular services using providers
item.description: With Angular 2 on its way, it seems like a lot of developers are now afraid of Angular 1.x. I have nothing bad to say about Angular.

item.title: Decorating directives with isolate scope in Angular 1.3
item.description: A question from reddit excited my interest. Angular 1.3 apparently has broken the ability to decorate isolate scopes. I tried version of Angular between the 1.

item.title: Manually debugging Angular scope
item.description: While a utility like Angular Batarang is invaluable, you’ll sometimes want to quickly and effectively inspect what exists on a given scope.

item.title: Your First App: Node.js is complete!
item.description: I’m stoked to announce that I’ve finished writing my first self-published book, Your First App: node.js. The book is a full-stack application development tutorial using what is commonly known as the ‘MEAN’ stack, but with a heavier focus on the backend technologies: node.

item.title: Your first app: Node.js (update)
item.description: I am currently writing a book called Your first app: Node.js. I am self-publishing this book through leanpub.com. You can check it out here.

item.title: Release: New Tab Redirect 3.0
item.description: On Wednesday, I began the rollout of New Tab Redirect 3.0 with some bug fixes and a huge new feature: a built in ‘Apps’ page.

item.title: Karma error: RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
item.description: I’ve been working on a bootstrap application for express.js, angular.js, and bootstrap. The idea being that I can provide a boilerplate for quick prototyping of applications.
